djangotailoring.util¶

A smattering of helpful functions that havn’t any other natural home.

Formatting¶

lazyformat(s, f)¶
Parameters:
  • s (unicode) – the format string
  • f (a dictionary) – the formatting dictionary
Return type:

a lazy-unicode object

This is a lazy version of the % operator. This allows string formatting using dictionaries to be postponed until necessary. It is important when using lazy-unicode objects as either the format string itself, or values in the formatting dictionary.

nowrapper(value[, tagnames=None])¶
Parameters:
  • value (str or unicode) – the string to be modified
  • tagnames (a list of str or unicode objects) – a list of tag names that are qualified for removal
Return type:

str or unicode

Given a Unicode or String object value, locate a surrounding html/xml-style tag surrounding value, and remove it. Tags found with names not in the tagnames list are left intact. If the list is empty, or not provided, tags with any name are removed.

Path Manipulation¶

namebase(pth)¶
Parameters:pth (str or unicode) – a path
Returns:pth without its extension and without its enclosing path
